a.title: San Elizario ISD Resolution to Pay Employees during COVID-19 Closure

div.a: San Elizario ISD Resolution to Pay Employees during COVID-19 Closure

div.span: San Elizario ISD Resolution to Pay Employees during COVID-19 Closure

div.h2: San Elizario ISD Resolution to Pay Employees during COVID-19 Closure

div.div: San Elizario ISD Resolution to Pay Employees during COVID-19 Closure

img.alt: SEISD Resolution to Pay Employees during COVID-19 Closure Approved

div.img:
SAN ELIZARIO, TX The San Elizario Independent School District Board of Trustees held an emergency meeting on Thursday, March 19, 2020 to approve a resolution, which will compensate employees during the districts closure of March 23rd through April 3rd in response to the corona virus COVID-19 pandemic.
Superintendent Dr. Jeannie Meza-Chavez made the decision to close the district as soon as the first case of the COVID-19 was confirmed by City of El Paso Officials on the evening of Friday, March 13, 2020. Once the first COVID-19 case was confirmed, the decision was made in the best interest of our students, employees and the Community of San Elizario. states Superintendent Meza-Chavez.
The decision to extend the closure was then cemented upon attending a meeting with the Department of Public Health on the evening of March 14, 2020, where a memo from Public Health Director Robert Resendes and Medical Director Hector Ocaranza, states, We are directing school districts to have students return from Spring Break on April 6, 2020. This recommendation is an effort to flatten the curve and practice social distancing in order to minimize the spread of COVID-19.
The resolution indicates all employees to include substitutes and tutors who were earning wages and on the districts payroll as of January 1, 2020 will continue to be paid. Human Resources Director, Ms. Blanca Cruz, states, Substitutes will be paid an average of their Januarys and Februarys pay.
During the district closure, a non-exempt employee who is required to report to duty by their supervisor and contacted by the Human Resources Department to report will receive premium pay as indicated under policy DEA.
Board Chair Sandra Licon states, We feel strongly that during this closure, it is essential for our personnel to continue to receive compensation because they have families and homes to care for. We are all in this together and together we will see it through.

div.div: 1050 Chicken Ranch Rd., San Elizario, TX 79849

div.span:
San Elizario Independent School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability, or age in its programs, activities, or employment.
El Distrito Escolar de San Elizario no discrimina en base a raza, color, nacionalidad, religin, sexo, discapacidad, y/o edad, en sus programas, actividades, o empleo.
